div.head: Supplementary Experimental Protocol
div.p: Plasmid construction. All PCR reactions were carried out using PfuTurbo DNA polymerase (Stratagene, La Jolla, CA). All restriction enzymes were from New England Biolabs (Beverly, MA). All oligonucleotide PCR primers were from Qiagen Operon (Alameda, CA). Plasmid pREP(1) (Fig. 1A) was constructed in two steps. In the first step, plasmid p43 was generated by triple ligation of a 3.4-kilobase pair (kbp) ApaLI-BglI fragment of pACYC177 (New England Biolabs) containing the p15A origin of replication and the kanamycin (Kn) resistance gene, a 0.3-kbp BamHI-AatII PCR fragment of the rrnB transcription termination region from plasmid pBAD/Myc-His A (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) generated using primers REP#2F and REP#2aR, and a 2.7kbp AatII-ApaLI PCR fragment of T7 RNAP from plasmid pBH161 (ref. 20) generated using primers REP#2aF and REP#4R. In the second step, plasmid pREP(1) was constructed by triple ligation of a 5.9-kbp BglI-ApaLI fragment of p43, a 1.4-kbp ApaLI-PstI PCR fragment of the araC gene and ara promoter from pBAD/Myc-His A, and a 0.9-kbp PstI-BglI PCR fragment generated by overlap PCR of a 0.1-kbp PCR fragment of the T7 terminator region from plasmid pET-11a (Novagen, Madison, WI) generated using primers REP#5F and REP#5aR, a 0.7-kbp PCR fragment of the GFPuv gene from plasmid pGFPuv (Clontech, Palo Alto, CA) generated using primers REP#5aF and REP#5bR, and a 0.1-kbp PCR fragment of the T7 promoter region from plasmid pET-12a (Novagen) generated using primers REP#5bF and REP#1R, and amplified using primers REP#5F and REP#1R. Plasmids pREP(2-12) (Fig. 1B) were constructed by ligation of a 5.5-kbp ApaLI-HpaI fragment of pREP(1) with 1.7-kbp HpaI-ApaLI variant PCR fragments of the T7 RNAP N-terminal region. Variant PCR fragments for pREP(2-4) were generated using pREP(1) as template and primer REP#3F with REP#4R2, REP#4R3, or REP#4R4, respectively. Variant PCR fragments for pREP(5-9) were constructed by overlap PCR of two PCR fragments generated using pREP(1) as template and primer pairs REP#3F-REP#3eR and REP#3eF-REP#4R5 for pREP(5), REP#3F-REP#3dR and REP#3dF-REP#4R5 for pREP(6), REP#3F-REP#3cR and REP#3cF-REP#4R5 for pREP(7), REP#3F-REP#3bR and REP#3bF-REP#4R5 for pREP(8), REP#3F-REP#3aR and REP#3aF-REP#4R5 for pREP(9). Overlap extensions of T7 RNAP fragments for pREP(5-9) were amplified using primers REP#3F and REP#4R5.

Variant PCR fragments for pREP(10-12) were generated using primers REP#3F and REP#4 with pREP(6, 7, and 9), respectively, as template. Plasmid pQ was cons tructed in two steps. In the first step, plasmid p3 was generated by triple ligation of a 3.6-kbp SalI-AatII fragment of pBR322 (New England Biolabs) containing the ColE1 origin of replication and an ampicillin-resistance gene, a 0.9-kbp AatII-BamHI PCR fragment containing the C-terminal region of the ScQRS gene and the E. coli QRS transcription termination region generated by PCR of plasmid pBLAM-HYQRS (ref. 6) using primers Q#2F and Q#3R, and a 1.9-kbp BamHI-SalI PCR fragment generated by overlap PCR of a 1.7-kbp PCR fragment of the N-terminal region of the ScQRS gene from plasmid pBLAM-HYQRS generated using primers Q#3F and Q#3aR and a 0.1-kbp PCR fragment of the lac promoter from plasmid pGFPuv generated using primers Q#3aF and Q#4R, and amplified using primers Q#3F and Q#4R. In the second step, plasmid pQ was constructed by ligation of a 5.7-kbp AvaI-SalI fragment of p3 and a 0.3-kbp SalI-AvaI PCR fragment containing the S. cerevisiae tRNA(CUA) Gln between the lpp promoter and the rrnC

monogr.title: Plasmid pREP/YC-JYCUA (Fig. 2A) was constructed by ligation of a 6.6-kbp SacII-AfeI fragment of pREP(10) and a 3.7kbp calf intestinal alkaline phosphatase (CIP; New England Biolabs)-treated fragment of pYC-J17 (ref. 7), digested first with EarI, followed by blunting with Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs), followed by digestion with SacII. The desired pREP/YC-JYCUA construct was identified by transformation of the ligation reaction into cells containing plasmid pBK-JYRS (ref. 7) and screening for fluorescence on LB agar plates

biblStruct.note: region from plasmid pACYOA38 (ref. 6 AvrII-BamHI fragment of pQ with a 1.1-kbp BamHI-AvrII fragment of pBLAM-QRS(D291A) (ref. 6), which contains a mutation of Asp291 to alanine in ScQRS Plasmid pBAD/JYAMB-4TAG was constructed by ligation of a 5.3-kbp NcoI-KpnI fragment of plasmid pBAD/YC-JYCUA and a 0.5-kbp PCR fragment of a Ser4 amber mutant of sperm whale myoglobin with a C-terminal His 6 -tag generated using primers AMBF and AMBR. Plasmid pBAD/YC-JYCUA, which contains the MjYtRNA CUA gene and the pBAD promoter and cloning regions for heterologous expression of an inserted gene, was constructed in two steps In the first step, a 3.5- kbp NcoI-linearized fragment of plasmid pYC-J17 (ref. 7), treated sequentially with CIP, Klenow, and PvuII, was ligated to a 2.9-kbp BglI-linearized fragment of plasmid pBAD/Myc-His A (Invitrogen) treated sequentially with CIP, ApaLI, and Klenow In the second step, the 6.4-kbp ligation product was treated with BsaAI and ScaI and ligated to form the 5.3-kbp circular product. Oligonucleotide PCR primers: REP#2F: 5'-CTGGGTACTGGATCCTCCGGGCCGTTGCTTCGC-3' REP#2aR: 5'-TTCGCCTAAGACGTCGGATGAGAGAAGATTTTCAG-3'

region from plasmid pACYOA38 (ref. 6) generated using primers Q#4F and Q#1R. Plasmid pQD was constructed by ligation of a 4.9-kbp AvrII-BamHI fragment of pQ with a 1.1-kbp BamHI-AvrII fragment of pBLAM-QRS(D291A) (ref. 6), which contains a mutation of Asp291 to alanine in ScQRS. Plasmid pREP/YC-JYCUA (Fig. 2A) was constructed by ligation of a 6.6-kbp SacII-AfeI fragment of pREP(10) and a 3.7- kbp calf intestinal alkaline phosphatase (CIP; New England Biolabs)-treated fragment of pYC-J17 (ref. 7), digested first with EarI, followed by blunting with Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs), followed by digestion with SacII. The desired pREP/YC- JYCUA construct was identified by transformation of the ligation reaction into cells containing plasmid pBK-JYRS (ref. 7) and screening for fluorescence on LB agar plates. Plasmid pBAD/JYAMB-4TAG was constructed by ligation of a 5.3-kbp NcoI-KpnI fragment of plasmid pBAD/YC-JYCUA and a 0.5-kbp PCR fragment of a Ser4 amber mutant of sperm whale myoglobin with a C-terminal His 6 -tag generated using primers AMBF and AMBR. Plasmid pBAD/YC-JYCUA, which contains the MjYtRNA CUA gene and the pBAD promoter and cloning regions for heterologous expression of an inserted gene, was constructed in two steps. In the first step, a 3.5-kbp NcoI-linearized fragment of plasmid pYC-J17 (ref. 7), treated sequentially with CIP, Klenow, and PvuII, was ligated to a 2.9-kbp BglI-linearized fragment of plasmid pBAD/Myc-His A (Invitrogen) treated sequentially with CIP, ApaLI, and Klenow. In the second step, the 6.4-kbp ligation product was treated with BsaAI and ScaI and ligated to form the 5.3-kbp circular product. Oligonucleotide PCR primers: REP#2F: 5'-CTGGGTACTGGATCCTCCGGGCCGTTGCTTCGC-3' REP#2aR: 5'-TTCGCCTAAGACGTCGGATGAGAGAAGATTTTCAG-3'

REP#2aF: 5'-CTCTCATCCGACGTCTTAGGCGAAGGCGAAGTCCGACTCTAAG-3' REP#4R: 5'-ATGATTACCGTGCACTAGAATACCATTAACATTGCTAAGAACGAC- TTCTCTGAC-3' REP#5F: 5'-GGTCACAGCCTGCAGCAAAAAACCCCTCAAGACCCG-3' REP#5aR: 5'-GCTCTACAAATAACAAAGCCCGAAAGGAAGCTG-3' REP#5aF: 5'-CTTTCGGGCTTTGTTATTTGTAGAGCTCATCCATGC-3' REP#5bR: 5'-GGAGATATACATATGAGTAAAGGAGAAGAACT-3'

monogr.title: REP#4R5: 5'-ATTACCGTGCACAATACCATTAACATTGCTAAGAACTAGTTCTCTGAC-ATCGAA-3' REP#3eR: 5'-GAAGTGAAAGCTAAGTAGGGCAAGCGC-3' REP#3eF: 5'-GCGCTTGCCCTACTTAGCTTTCACTTC-3' REP#3dR: 5'-TCCTGTAGGAAATCAAGCCGGAAGCC-3' REP#3dF: 5'-GGCTTCCGGCTTGATTTCCTACAGGA-3' REP#3cR: 5'-ATCCGTGACCTTGAATAGAAGCACTT-3' REP#3cF: 5'-GAAGTGCTTCTATTCAAGGTCACGGAT-3' REP#3bR: 5'-GAGGAATAGCTCAACAAGCGCGTAGGG-3' REP#3bF: 5'-CCCTACGCGCTTGTTGAGCTATTCCTC-3
